translated: Jātaka
Ten-&-Twelve🔽The Four Gates
The Saṅkha Jātaka

analyzed: bahu sutaḥ suta dhammaḥ asi saṅkha
translated: “You’re learned, Saṅkha, and know the Dhamma.
You’ve seen the ascetics and brahmins.
But you weep at the wrong time.

original: Añño nu ko te paṭimantako mayā”.
analyzed: aññaḥ nu ko te paṭimantakaḥ mayā
translated: Is there anyone else who can help me?”
“Subbhū, Subhā, Suppaṭimukkakambu,
In a golden bowl,

analyzed: bhuñjassu bhatte iti mama vada iti
translated: ‘Eat your food,’ he says to me.
Faithful and devoted,
I say ‘yes’ to him.”
“Seeing such a spirit as this,
A man seeking happiness should ask:
‘Rise up! With palms together, ask him:

original: Devī nusi tvaṁ uda mānusī nu”.
analyzed: devī nusi tvam uda mānusī nu
translated: Are you a goddess or a human?’”
“You look at me with happiness,
And say, ‘Eat your food.’
I ask you, lady of great power,

original: Devī nusi tvaṁ uda mānusī nu”.
analyzed: devī nusi tvam uda mānusī nu
translated: Are you a goddess or a human?”
“I’m a goddess, Saṅkha, of great power,
Who’s come here to the middle of the ocean.
I’m compassionate, not malicious,

analyzed: tava iva atthāya idha āgatā asmi
translated: And I’ve come here for your sake.

analyzed: idhan apānam sayana āsanañca  yānāni nānā vividhāni
translated: “Food and drink, beds and seats,
And various kinds of vehicles, I offer you all,
Whatever you desire in your mind.”

analyzed: yam kiñci yiṭṭham ca hutam ca mayha
translated: “Whatever has been given or offered to me,
You are the sole lord of all, O Blessed One;
O well-born one, well-spoken one, in the midst of the well-adorned,
What is the result of this deed of mine?”

analyzed: ghamme pathe brāhmaṇaḥ eka bhikkhu  ugghaṭṭa pādam tasitam kilanta
translated: “On the road, O brahmin, a single monk,🔽With split feet, exhausted and weary;
You offered him sandals,
That offering yields only suffering.”
“Let it be a boat with a plank as a support,
Unsinkable, with a wind from a bellows;

analyzed: aññassa yānassa na ha ittha bhūmi
translated: There is no place here for another vehicle,
Today itself, take me to the island.”
“There, delighted, she descended,
Having created a beautiful boat;
Taking the conch with the man,
She brought it to the city, with a good mind.”
The Conch Birth Story, fourth.
